name: Hotel Al Malcanton

reviews.text: We stayed here pre and post cruise and enjoyed our stay both times. The room was comfortable, well decorated and both the bedroom and bathroom were spotlessly clean. It had all the required amenities. We had an extra bed for our teenager in the room and it was still quite roomy.
reviews.title: Nice hotel and value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owner was helpful allowing us to store our copious amounts of luggage and in directing us to good restaurants nearby. Directions to the hotel were a little confusing as the landmark given was a florists, which is fine if you arrive when it is open, but after closing time you cannot tell it is a florist!! A tip is get directions to the AL Sole hotel and it is across the bridge from there and right turn into a small courtyard.
reviews.title: Spring in Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two little niggles, no normal breakfast teabags (green teas/fruit teas only) and no extra pillow was available which I found amazing for a hotel.
reviews.title: Great room and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was more than adequate in every other way.
reviews.title: Good value, nice area, 5 mins from Piazzale Roma.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall though we felt we had real value for money in a quiet and convenient location away from the tourist hordes.
reviews.title: Good value - Very good rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Al Malcanton is an easy walk from the station and if you follow their instructions, it is not hard to find. The rooms are comfortable and very clean. After walking all over Venice, exploring the sights, we were pleased to have a room in a quiet hotel where a good night's sleep was ensured. This is a simple hotel but it met our needs in every way.
reviews.title: A lovely little hotel in a quiet location.

reviews.text: When I booked this hotel I wondered why there were hardly any reviews since it opened in 2009 and I was a bit skeptical. No worries here, this hotel is quiet, cozy and well managed. It is actually two hotels one above the other managed by the same group. The attention to detail and comfort of our room was really evident after coming from a hotel in Rome that was a bit disappointing. I can also see how it would be hard to find but prior to our arrival we received an email with step by step directions and a pdf. map. Peter the owner quickly became a trusted friend doling out advice and humour. The european style breakfast was ample warm and fresh each morning. Wi-fi is included and simple to access. Clean well decorated and fairly spacious for Europe. Modern fixtures and Murano glass light fixtures.
reviews.title: This hotel is a hidden gem !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: EXCELLENT CHOICE FOR CARNIVAL

reviews.text: We have stayed during the carnival 2011 for three nights, rooms are very clean and decorated Venetian style. Location is not close to San Marco but it is good to be far away from crowd and it gives you a choice to discover other squares very close to bus staion and train station, breakfast is ok as a continental breakfast. Silent surroundings let you
reviews.title: The accomodations are excellent and staff is great!

reviews.text: My friends and I recently stayed in the hotel's triple room, incredibly spacious, spotless and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Best value stay in beautiful Venice with fabulous location

reviews.text: Our host was a gorgeous little Venetian man with a wicked sense of 'dry' humour and a warm heart.
reviews.title: Nothing great, but not bad.

reviews.text: The location is in an excellent location. Only 5 minutes stroll from the bus and train stations WITHOUT what that usually entails.
reviews.title: Superb!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's in a quiet part of town very well serviced by yummy cafes & restaurants at much cheaper prices than around the main traps. The Dosoduro locale is great and a lovely stroll or boat ride from this gorgeous, clean, well run & very welcoming hotel. I will be staying again & recommending it to my friends.
reviews.title: good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We liked our stay at Hotel Al Macanton. The location was very good (hotel is located off a quiet courtyard) and our host was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was just ok, simple plain croissant, yogurt, cereal and packaged cheeses but the coffee (in various forms) was excellent. The room was pretty small (we were a family of 4 sharing) and the beds were uncomfortable. While not an amazing value, the price wasn’t bad, as everything is pretty expensive in Venice.
reviews.title: Nice Hidden Gem in Venice

description: The Hotel Al Malcanton, a brand new hotel has been attentively designed with large, comfortable rooms, decorated in the typical style of 18th-century Venice.
